com.beaglebuddy.id3.v23.frame_body

Class ID3v23FrameBodyTermsOfUse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.beaglebuddy.util.Utility
      • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBodyUtility
        • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBody
          • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBodyTermsOfUse

  • public class ID3v23FrameBodyTermsOfUse
extends ID3v23FrameBody

    A terms of use frame body is associated with an ID3v2.3 USER frame which is used to include a brief description of the terms of use and/or ownership of the .mp3 file. More detailed information concerning the legal terms might be available through the Copyright/Legal information frame. The terms of use frame body contains the following fields:

    Terms of Use Frame Body Fields
     FieldDescription
    1. encodingcharacter set used to encode the text field.
    2. languagelanguage that the text field is written in.
    3. text the actual terms of use or ownership of the .mp3 file.

    There may only be one terms of use frame in an ID3v2.3 tag.

    See Also:
    ID3v23Frame, ID3 tag version 2.3.0 standard, wikipedia history of ID3 tags

    • Constructor Detail

      • ID3v23FrameBodyTermsOfUse

        public ID3v23FrameBodyTermsOfUse()
        The default constructor is called when creating a new frame. The default values used are:
        • ISO-8859-1 encoding
        • english language
        • empty text

      • ID3v23FrameBodyTermsOfUse

        public ID3v23FrameBodyTermsOfUse(Encoding encoding,
                         Language language,
                         java.lang.String text)
        This constructor is called when creating a new frame.

        Parameters:
        encoding - character set used to encode the terms of use.
        language - ISO-639-2 language code.
        text - text.

      • ID3v23FrameBodyTermsOfUse

        public ID3v23FrameBodyTermsOfUse(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                         int frameBodySize)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        This constructor is called when reading in an existing frame from an .mp3 file. This is then followed by a call to the parse() method.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - input stream pointing to a terms of use frame body in the .mp3 file.
        frameBodySize - size (in bytes) of the frame's body.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading the frame body.

      • setBuffer

        public void setBuffer()
        If the frame body's values have been modified, then resize the raw binary buffer and store the new values there. When finished, the dirty flag is reset to indicate that the buffer is up to date, and the frame is now ready to be saved to the .mp3 file.
        Overrides:
        setBuffer in class ID3v23FrameBody

        Returns:
        a string representation of the frame body.
